Basic Inspection: Check for signs of leaks, cracks, damages and touch up with new paint (if applicable) on Main Equipment
Check for signs of leaks, cracks, damages and touch up with new paint (if applicable) on Pipe and Fittings
Check for signs of leaks, cracks, damages and touch up with new paint (if applicable) on Auxiliary Valves
Check correct gas pre-charged pressure is maintained
Check indication of the set point and actual temperature
Check operating pressure and volume flow
Check for leaks and damage of the equipment

Visual check on the stem position of inlet and outlet solenoid operated air pilot valves during the catalyst convertor operation. During operation, the stem of the pilot valves will protrude out which indicate that the valves is in working condition.
Check if the port on the back of catalyst reactor is tight and firmly closed

Basic Servicing: Maintenance of the safety valves
Replace inlet and outlet solenoid valves

Advanced Servicing: Replace the catalyst granules

Basic Inspection: Check duct supports for signs of corrosion; rectify corrosion & touch up

Basic Servicing: Check gear reducer oil level, fill up when necessary
Check wire mesh condition, replace if necessary
Check spray nozzles: dismantle one panel - check nozzles are not clogged; remove and clean if necessary; check wash-water pressure; adjust nozzles to ensure entire mesh surface is washed
Check chain tension, wear of sprocket teeth and chain rollers

Advanced Servicing: Provide manpower, lubricants, special tools and handling devices to inspect and record measurements, make recommendations, drain and refill gear reducer oil and grease bearings as per O&M manual

Basic Servicing: Grease bearings
Traction chain - Check tension and alignment, grease manually, 5 millimetres equally tighten.
Remove sand and gravel particles
Clean, and derust. Replace bolts and nuts if necessary. Check filter mesh, sprayers, solids scraper, cleaning rakes and filter panel

Basic Inspection: Check condition of plastic wheels and closing plates

Intermediate Servicing: Check condition of filter screen and clean with pressurised water jet
Check and refill gearmotor oil

Basic Servicing: Check bolted connections are tight
Check combing of rake in bar screen is non-contract; and distance of cromb to apron is about 2 - 3 mm
Check function of wiping devices work - no remains & moves back easily
Grease wire rope; slack rope device; pivoting gear drive pulley and shaft;
Check oil level in gear drive, refill if necessary
Visual check rope for breaks or twists

Intermediate Servicing: Check rollers of rope tension device
Check carriage rollers for wear
Replace grease at flange bearings and spindle gears

Basic Servicing: Check mesh panel frames and chain. Ensure bolted connections are tight
Visual check spray pattern of nozzles. Ensure spray pattern is even and mesh panels clean
Check that the trough & wash water channel is flowing evenly
Check oil level in gear drive, refill if necessary

Intermediate Servicing: Check chain tension, wear of sprocket teeth and chain rollers
Clean & change grease for drive shaft bearing, and non-surface-coated threaded spindle

Check for signs of leaks, cracks, damages and touch up with new paint (if applicable) on Pipes and Fittings
Check for signs of leaks, cracks, damages and touch up with new paint (if applicable) on Auxiliary Valves
Check for faulty gauges, to replace if necessary

Check drive belt. Change or retension as necessary.

Visual check shaft seal, tighten if necessary
Regrease bearings
Replace air filter
check blow-off valve

overhaul blower

Check the control unit’s components for wear and replace if necessary

Check for oil leaks

Check tightness of foundation bolts

Check for faulty pressure gauges (if available); replace faulty gauges

Visual inspect and clean both the water inlet filter and brine inlet filter.

Basic Servicing: Tighten any loose bolts and nuts. Replace rusty bolts and nuts.
Check for signs of leaks, cracks, damages and touch up with new paint (if applicable) on Energy Recovery System
Check LinX valve oil collection drains. Repair seals if leak is present.
Check LinX Valve Limit Switches and Energy Recovery Vessel limit switch. Adjust if necessary.
Record condition monitoring parameters (e.g. gear pump discharge pressure)

Advanced Servicing: Check ER Vessel Piston Flapper. Repair if ER Vessel Piston flapper is damaged.
Check alignment of each layer according to OEM manual using a digital levelling gauge during installation
Check for minor cracks on mating flange surfacees using penetrant test. Perform repair (metal build etc) as necessary.
Check concrete supports for cracks, repair if necessary
Replace all oil seals and spring as necessary.

Basic Servicing: Check, clean and change if necessary and applicable
Check and clean filter
Inspect cartridges spring condition, if applicable. Replace if necessary

Replace gas filter element

Inspect the filter air release valves and drainage ball valves for any passing.
Disassemble the filter’s covers and inspect the filter internal components and seal for any wear and tear;
Check the filter housing and cover for any sign of mechanical damage. Replace any damaged components.
Remove barnacles or foreign particles and replace any broken disc, if found.

Check for tightness of each butterfly nut using a torque wrench and special wrench (760109-000060), set to 10Nm

Basic Servicing: Visual inspection of the tank from ground level, include removing of algae and repainting of vessel if required.
Visual inspection of Evacuation ports, vacuum gauge valves and related valves where applicable

Inspection and functional testing of all PRVs, inclusive of PRVs along the O2/CO2 pipeline. Replace PRV if required, including the test certificate to the required setting pressure.

Check LOX/CO2 storage tank vacuum reading. Pump and reinstate the vacuum within the acceptable range if required.
To open and replace valve seat for Upper Filling Valve and Lower Filling Valve. Check for leaks on the valves. Valve seats to be provided by Contractor
To replace the Rupture Discs for the inner vessel. Rupture discs to be provided by the Contractor

Perform bubble test

Check any sign of cavitation by looking at flowmeter. If the flowmeter actual flow is lesser than theoretical flow at the rated speed, cavitation might occur. Note and report for any abnormalities
Powerframe - check the oil level, top up if below 50%, half of the oil cup level. Investigate rootcause for leak and rectify
Test run equipment before handing over to Ops, if any parts replaced

Advanced Inspection: Inspect coupling, pump & motor bolting, check the alignment and is there any sign of loose

Inspect internal pump components as follows. Bearings, Shafts, Gears, Housing Liner. Pump dismantling is not required for alignment. For pump internal wet ends inspection, not required to dismantle the whole pump from system, but just open the head cover
Test run equipment before handing over to Ops, if any parts replaced

Advanced Servicing: Replace Pump End Spare parts (Kopkit): Liner Housing, Gears, O-ring Cover and bearing, by dismantling the front cover for replacment.
Drain and change lubricating oil for the Powerframe Shaft lubrication.
Calibrate using Flowmeter.
Carry out shaft alignment.
Test run equipment before handing over to Ops

Check for signs of leaks, cracks, damages on Strainers (if available); to clean internal of strainer
Tighten any loose bolts and nuts. Replace rusty bolts and nuts

Check and top up hydraulic oil and/or gear oil if required
Tighten any loose bolts and nuts. Replace rusty bolts and nuts

Basic Servicing: Check for signs of corrosion; rectify and touch up with new paint
Check clamps and jubilee clips (if available) for corrosion and damage. To replace if required
Check for leaks in valves and pipe system; rectify leaks, if applicable
Top up hydraulic oil, if applicable
Lift pump out of sump pit, inspect and clean.

Basic Inspection: Check level and colour of oil, top up if low or replace if milky
Check for signs of leaks, cracks, damages and touch up with new paint (if applicable) on pump
Check and clean inlet & exhaust filters

Basic Servicing: Check for signs of leaks, cracks, damages and touch up with new paint (if applicable) on Main Equipment
Check for signs of leaks, cracks, damages and touch up with new paint (if applicable) on Pipe and Fittings
Check for signs of leaks, cracks, damages on and touch up with new paint (if applicable) for Auxiliary Valves
Replace Pre-Filter Element, if applicable
Replace Micro-Filter Element, if applicable

Intermediate Servicing: Replace Ultra-Filter element, if applicable
Clean and Grease PSA process valves using Oxygenoex S4 or equivalent

Advanced Servicing: Replace Molecular Sieve (if recommended by OEM)
Inspect Internals of process columns/ tanks (if recommended by OEM)
Replace top brass filters (if PSA system is on standby)
Replace process valves, if necessary (if PSA system is on standby)
Replace main inlet pressure regulator (if PSA system is on standby)

Basic Inspection: Check for signs of air or lime leaks. Rectify any faults
Check condition of pneumatic tubing. Rectify any faults
Check and rectify faulty rubber bellow and springs, if applicable
Clean and check dust filter bag condition. Rectify any faults (including charger hopper, if any)
Operate silo hopper knife gate or isolation valve. Rectify any faults

Basic Servicing: Replace dehumidifer and/or dust collector filters (if available)
Replace pneumatic tubings
Clean up silo top, and touch up corroded areas with new paint
Test run equipment before handing over to Ops, if any parts replaced

Advanced Servicing: Replace Flexible Blades of Arch Breaker Assembly, if applicable.

Basic Inspection: Check for signs of leaks, cracks, damages and touch up with new paint (if applicable) on Main Equipment
Check for signs of leaks, cracks, damages and touch up with new paint (if applicable) on Pipes and Fittings
Tighten any loose bolts and nuts. Replace rusty bolts and nuts
Clean rotameter (if any); replace if necessary

Advanced Servicing: Replace resin

Basic Inspection: Check for signs of leaks, cracks, damages and touch up with new paint (if applicable) on Main Equipment
Check for signs of leaks, cracks, damages and touch up with new paint (if applicable) on Pipes and Fittings
Check for signs of leaks, cracks, damages and touch up with new paint (if applicable) on Auxiliary Valves
Check for signs of leaks, cracks, damages on Strainers (if available); to clean internal of strainer if required
Check for faulty pressure gauges (if available); replace faulty gauges
Tighten any loose bolts and nuts. Replace rusty bolts and nuts
Remove screen for inspection and manual cleaning, replace O-ring
Inspect brushes for any wear and tear.
Check and replace hydraulic seals if required
Grease the brush assembly shaft
Check and record air/water ratio, liquid level between the 2 markings on the sight glass
Visual inspect for signs of leaks and corrosion. Rectify and touch up with new paint if necessary
Check for faulty pressure gauges, to replace if necessary.

Basic Servicing: Clean manometer or sight glass where isolation valve is available
Clean Strainer, if any, replace if faulty
Check for signs of corrosion, clean and touch up with new paint on tanks and railings
For tank with dust collector - clean filter bag and filter nozzles, replace if necessary
For tank with dust collector - replace pneumatic tubings

Clear tank connecting pipes. Rectify any: Flush internal of overflow pipe, tank connecting pipes, tank inlet and outlet pipes, all off-takes from the tank. Rectify any faults
Drain tank and pressure jet tank interior for lime. For other chemicals, pressure jet if instructed. Replace manhole gasket if manhole was opened. Replace other flange gaskets where needed.

Basic Inspection: Check for signs of leaks, cracks, damages and touch up with new paint (if applicable) on Main Equipment
Check for signs of leaks, cracks, damages and touch up with new paint (if applicable) on Pipes and Fittings
Check for signs of leaks, cracks, damages and touch up with new paint (if applicable) on Auxiliary Valves
Check for signs of leaks, cracks, damages on Strainers (if available); to clean internal of strainer if required
Check for faulty pressure gauges (if available); replace faulty gauges
Tighten any loose bolts and nuts. Replace rusty bolts and nuts
Record and trend the running temperature and pressure reading of the heat exchanger inlet and outlet, if no SCADA trending available
Check and top-up refrigerant if required
Check the water level in the storage tank, if found the water level drop, open the valve until it overflows then close back, if applicable
Check and refill compressor oil level, if necessary

Basic Servicing: Flush Clean external of condenser coils to remove dirt or airborne particle build-up.
Remove the screen filter from the strainer and clean, if applicable
Drain off the water tank, and replace the water, if applicable
Test run equipment before handing over to Ops, if any parts replaced

Advanced Inspection: Performance of detailed inspection by OEM
